Sentencas: This work focuses on the comparison of Ln-Ni-O coatings (Ln = La, Nd, Pr) deposited by reactive magnetron sputtering using Plasma Emission Monitoring (PEM) which allows high deposition rate.
Titulo: Ln2NiO4+δ (Ln = La, Pr, Nd) coatings deposited by reactive magnetron sputtering as cathode material for intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: Each layer is deposited by different steps.
Titulo: Ln2NiO4+δ (Ln = La, Pr, Nd) coatings deposited by reactive magnetron sputtering as cathode material for intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: The optimal regulation setpoint for oxide rare-earth deposition is determined
Titulo: Ln2NiO4+δ (Ln = La, Pr, Nd) coatings deposited by reactive magnetron sputtering as cathode material for intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: and then the current dissipated on the nickel target is adjusted to obtain the convenient Ln/Ni ratio and to achieve the K2NiF4 structure.
Titulo: Ln2NiO4+δ (Ln = La, Pr, Nd) coatings deposited by reactive magnetron sputtering as cathode material for intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: After an appropriate annealing treatment, all coatings exhibit crystalline structures, which depend on the Ln/Ni ratio.
Titulo: Ln2NiO4+δ (Ln = La, Pr, Nd) coatings deposited by reactive magnetron sputtering as cathode material for intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: Due to the instability of Pr2NiO4 structure at intermediate temperatures, the crystallization step of praseodymium nickelate is performed at higher temperature than the other materials.
Titulo: Ln2NiO4+δ (Ln = La, Pr, Nd) coatings deposited by reactive magnetron sputtering as cathode material for intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: This further thermal treatment implies a more porous structure.
Titulo: Ln2NiO4+δ (Ln = La, Pr, Nd) coatings deposited by reactive magnetron sputtering as cathode material for intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cell
Ln2NiO4+δ (Ln = La, Pr, Nd) coatings deposited by reactive magnetron sputtering as cathode material for intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: Electrical and electrochemical characterizations performed on these deposits prove better properties of the praseodymium nickelate coating.
Titulo: Ln2NiO4+δ (Ln = La, Pr, Nd) coatings deposited by reactive magnetron sputtering as cathode material for intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cell
